result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander T Mielke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with BB.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

Defendant stands mute. Court enters plea of not guilty. Motions due in 20 days. Bail condition amended to:  Should not be in 1200 block fo MacArthur Rd without police escort.  All other conditions continue.
Waiver of Right to Prelim Hrg filed.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Brooke B.
  - Defendant shall not be in the 1200th block of Macarthur Rd in Madison, WI without police escort.
  - Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
